S75Plus Structures

#define NUM_S75PRO_DESTINATIONS   16
 S75 Plus based receivers that support the PRO feature set can forward each PID to several destinations.

 The network setting for the S75Plus is the same as for the S75 V3.

Functions

Device Selection Functions
int __stdcall discoverDevices (Novra_DeviceList *devices)
 Discovers all Novra receivers that are sending status reports on one of the 10 auto detect status ports.

 Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

 Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

 Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

 Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

 Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

Device Configuration Functions
int __stdcall configureNetwork (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *networkSettings)
 Changes the network parameters of a device.
int __stdcall configureRF (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *RFSettings)
 Changes the RF parameters of a device.
int __stdcall setPIDList (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *PIDs)
 Sets the PID filter on a device.
int __stdcall setProgramList (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *Programs)
 Sets the program filter on a device (only the S75CA & S75CA Pro support this functionality).
int __stdcall setPAT (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *PAT)
 Sets the PAT on a device (only the Pro devices support this functionality).
int __stdcall setFixedKeys (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *KeyTable)
 Sets the fixed keys on a device (S75FK & S75FK Pro).
int __stdcall setTraps (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *Traps)
 Sets the Traps on a device (CURRENTLY ONLY THE S75 JLeo SUPPORTS THIS FUNCTIONALITY).
int __stdcall setCAMWatchdogTimeout (S75_Handle S75Unit, WORD timeout)
 This function is used to set the CAM watchdog timeout on a CA device.
int __stdcall SetDVBMACAddress (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *DVBMAC)
 This function sets the DVB MAC of a device. (S75V3 only).
Device Query Functions
int __stdcall GetDeviceType (S75_Handle S75Unit, WORD &DevType)
 This function returns the device type.
int __stdcall getStatus (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *status)
 Retrieves status from a device.
int __stdcall getPIDList (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *PIDs)
 Retrieves the PID filter from a device.
int __stdcall getProgramList (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *Programs)
 Gets the program filter on a device (only the S75CA & S75CA Pro support this functionality).
int __stdcall getPAT (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *PAT)
 Gets the PAT on a device (only Pro devices support this functionality).
int __stdcall getFixedKeys (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *KeyTable)
 Gets the fixed keys from a device (S75FK & S75FK Pro).
int __stdcall getTraps (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *Traps)
 Gets the Traps settings on a device (CURRENTLY ONLY THE S75 JLeo SUPPORTS THIS FUNCTIONALITY).
int __stdcall getCAMWatchdogTimeout (S75_Handle S75Unit, WORD *timeout)
 This function is used to read the CAM watchdog timeout on a CA device.
Misc Functions
int __stdcall closeS75 (S75_Handle S75Unit)
 Disposes of an S75_Handle (closes communication connections).
int __stdcall calcSignalStrengthPercentage (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE AutomaticGainControl, BYTE DemodulatorGain, BYTE SignalLock, BYTE DataLock)
 Calculates signal strength as a percentage.
int __stdcall resetS75 (S75_Handle S75Unit)
 This function causes a reset of the device firmware.
int __stdcall resetCAM (S75_Handle S75Unit)
 This function causes a reset of the CAM on an S75CA or S75CA Pro device.
int __stdcall GetAvailablePort (WORD &Port)
 This function can be used to help choose a status port for a device.
void __stdcall getVersion (int *major, int *minor, int *day, int *month, int *year)
 Returns the version of the library and the release date.
JSAT Functions
S75_Handle __stdcall discoverRemoteDevice (BYTE *ip, int timeout)
 This function creates a handle for a remote Novra receiver by IP address.
int __stdcall pollStatus (S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE *status, int timeout=2000)
 This function will get the status of the S75Unit and fill the appropriate status structure. The status structure should be of the proper type for the device.
S75_Handle __stdcall openRemoteDevice (Novra_DeviceEntry *pDev, const int timeout, int &ErrorCode)
 This function retrieves a handle to the device pointed to by pDev.
int __stdcall changePassword (S75_Handle S75Unit, char *password, unsigned char key[16])
 This function changes the password on a unit (that supports passwords).
int __stdcall specifyPassword (S75_Handle S75Unit, char *password)
 This functions specifies the password to use when communicating with a unit.
S75_Handle __stdcall forceRemoteDevice (const Novra_DeviceEntry *pDev, WORD Port, const int timeout, int &ErrorCode)
 Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

Typedef Documentation

typedef S75_Handle A75_Handle

A pointer used in all ATSC device communications.

typedef S75D_NetSetting_V3 A75_NetSetting

The network setting for an A75 is the same as for an S75 V3.

typedef S75D_PIDList_V3 A75_PIDList

The PID list for an A75 is the same as for an S75 V3.

typedef S75D_NetSetting_V3 A75PesMaker_NetSetting

The A75PesMaker network setting is the same as the S75 V3.

typedef PesMaker_PIDList A75PesMaker_PIDList

The A75PesMaker PID list is the same as the S75 V5.X PesMaker.

typedef A75_RFSetting A75PesMaker_RFSetting

The A75PesMaker RF setting is the same as the A75.

typedef A75_Status A75PesMaker_Status

The A75PesMaker status is the same as the A75 status.

typedef S75D_NetSetting_V3 PesMaker_NetSetting

The network setting for the PesMaker is the same as for the S75 V3.

typedef S75D_RFSetting_V3 PesMaker_RFSetting

The RF setting for the PesMaker is the same as for the S75 V3.

typedef void* S75_Handle

A pointer used in all satellite device communications.

typedef S75D_NetSetting_V3 S75_NetSetting_JLEO

The S75Jleo network setting is the same as the S75 V3.

Pass a pointer to a populated instance of one of these to configureNetwork() if you are programming an S75 JLeo Device.

typedef S75D_PIDList S75_PIDList_JLEO

The S75JLEO PID list is the same as the S75 V2.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum NOVRA_DEVICES

Used to enumerate the Novra device types.

Enumerator:
S75_ANY  Used by the auto discovery class.
S75_UNKNOWN  A device that reports firmware that is not recognised or bad status packet.
S75_V_1  S75 Version 1 device, if we ever decide to support them.
S75D_V21  S75 Version 2.X device.
S75D_V3  S75 Version 3.X device.
A75  A75 device.
PesMaker  S75 Version 5.x PesMaker device.
S75CA  S75 Conditional Access device.
A75PesMaker  A75 PesMaker device.
S75_JLEO  S75 JSAT Leo-Palace device.
S75FK  S75 Fixed Key device.
S75PLUS  S75 Plus device.
S75CAPRO  S75 Conditional Access device with support for the PRO feature set.
S75FKPRO  S75 Fixed Key device with support for the PRO feature set.
S75PLUSPRO  S75 Plus device with support for the PRO feature set.

enum VITERBI_RATES

Used to enumerate the possible Viterbi rates.

Enumerator:
VITERBI_ERROR  The Viterbi rate is not known.
HALF  1/2
TWO_THIRDS  2/3
THREE_QUARTERS  3/4
FOUR_FIFTHS  4/5
FIVE_SIXTHS  5/6
SIX_SEVENTHS  6/7
SEVEN_EIGTHS  7/8
EIGHT_NINTHS  8/9

Function Documentation

S75_Handle __stdcall b_forceS75 ( const BYTE  S75MACAddress[6],
const BYTE  S75IPAddress[4],
const int *  statusPort,
const int *  timeout 
)

Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

This function is deprecated and should not be used. Use ForceDevice instead.

This function creates a handle for communicating with an S75 receiver by forcing the S75 with the specified MAC address to accept a new IP address and status port. This is different from the open functions because they do not change any of the device network settings, whereas the force functions destroy whatever network configuration previously existed.

Returns a valid S75_Handle or a NULL pointer

Parameters:
S75MACAddress  a 6 byte array containing the MAC address of the device
S75IPAddress  a 4 byte array containing the new IP address for the device
statusPort  a pointer to an int containing the status port the device is to use
timeout  a timeout (in milliseconds)

S75_Handle __stdcall b_openS75 ( const BYTE  S75IPAddress[4],
const BYTE  S75MACAddress[6],
const int *  statusPort,
const int *  timeout 
)

Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

Returns a valid S75_Handle or a NULL pointer

This function is deprecated and should not be used. Use openDevice instead.

Parameters:
S75IPAddress  a 4 byte array containing the IP address of the device
S75MACAddress  a 6 byte array containing the MAC address of the device
statusPort  a pointer to an int containing the status port used by the device
timeout  a pointer to an int containing a timeout (in milliseconds)

int __stdcall calcSignalStrengthPercentage ( S75_Handle  S75Unit,
BYTE  AutomaticGainControl,
BYTE  DemodulatorGain,
BYTE  SignalLock,
BYTE  DataLock 
)

Calculates signal strength as a percentage.

This functions should only be used for satellite receivers

Returns a number between 0 and 100.

Parameters:
AutomaticGainControl  AGC value from device status
DemodulatorGain  Demodulator gain from device status
SignalLock  Signal lock flag from device statuis
DataLock  Data lock flag from device status

int __stdcall changePassword ( S75_Handle  S75Unit,
char *  password,
unsigned char  key[16] 
)

This function changes the password on a unit (that supports passwords).

int __stdcall closeS75 ( S75_Handle  S75Unit  ) 

Disposes of an S75_Handle (closes communication connections).

Parameters:
S75Unit  the S75_Handle of the device to be closed

int __stdcall configureNetwork ( S75_Handle  S75Unit,
BYTE *  networkSettings 
)

Changes the network parameters of a device.

Returns S75_OK or an ERROR code (see file s75.h)

The following networkSettings types are all equivalent to the S75D_NetSetting_V3 structure

  • A75_NetSetting

  • A75PesMaker_NetSetting

  • PesMaker_NetSetting

  • S75_NetSetting_JLEO

  • S75Plus_NetSetting

  • S75PlusPro_NetSetting

  • S75CA_NetSetting

  • S75CAPro_NetSetting

  • S75FK_NetSetting

  • S75FKPro_NetSetting
Parameters:
S75Unit  The S75_Handle of the device whose network settings are being configured
networkSettings  A pointer to a structure containing the network settings to use (one of S75D_NetSetting, S75D_NetSetting_V3, A75_NetSetting, A75PesMaker_NetSetting, PesMaker_NetSetting, S75_NetSetting_JLEO, S75Plus_NetSetting, S75PlusPro_NetSetting, S75CA_NetSetting, S75CAPro_NetSetting, S75FK_NetSetting, S75FKPro_NetSetting)

int __stdcall configureRF ( S75_Handle  S75Unit,
BYTE *  RFSettings 
)

Changes the RF parameters of a device.

Returns S75_OK or an ERROR code (see file s75.h)

The following networkSettings types are all equivalent to the S75D_RFSetting_V3 structure

  • PesMaker_RFSetting

The following networkSettings types are all equivalent to the S75Plus_RFSetting structure

  • S75PlusPro_RFSetting

  • S75CA_RFSetting

  • S75CAPro_RFSetting

  • S75FK_RFSetting

  • S75FKPro_RFSetting

The following networkSettings types are all equivalent to the A75_RFSetting structure

  • A75PesMaker_RFSetting
Parameters:
S75Unit  The S75_Handle of the device whose network settings are being configured
RFSettings  A pointer to a structure containing the RF settings to use (one of S75D_RFSetting, S75D_RFSetting_V3, A75_RFSetting, A75PesMaker_RFSetting, PesMaker_RFSetting, S75_RFSetting_JLEO, S75Plus_RFSetting, S75PlusPro_RFSetting, S75CA_RFSetting, S75CAPro_RFSetting, S75FK_RFSetting, S75FKPro_RFSetting)

int __stdcall discoverDevices ( Novra_DeviceList *  devices  ) 

Discovers all Novra receivers that are sending status reports on one of the 10 auto detect status ports.

Results are returned in the Novra_DeviceList pointed to by devices

Returns 0 on failure, 1 on success

Parameters:
devices  pointer to a structure of type Novra_DeviceList

Parameters:
ip  IP address of receiver
timeout  A timeout value in seconds

S75_Handle __stdcall forceDevice ( const Novra_DeviceEntry *  pDev,
WORD  Port,
const int  timeout,
int &  ErrorCode 
)

Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

Resets a device's network settings to the default and provides an S75_Handle to the device. In general, use of this functionality should be avoided. Use it when a device can't be reached using other means.

Returns a valid S75_Handle or a NULL pointer and an Error code (see file s75.h)

Parameters:
pDev  pointer to the Novra_DeviceEntry of the device being forced
Port  the status port the device should use
timeout  a pointer to an int containing a timeout (in milliseconds)
ErrorCode  error code (output)

S75_Handle __stdcall forceRemoteDevice ( const Novra_DeviceEntry *  pDev,
WORD  Port,
const int  timeout,
int &  ErrorCode 
)

Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

int __stdcall GetAvailablePort ( WORD &  Port  ) 

This function can be used to help choose a status port for a device.

It tries to find one of the 10 auto detect status ports that can be successfully used on the host machine. It does this by creating sockets experimentally until one works. Once found, it closes the experimental socket and returns the port number to the caller via the Port parameter.

Returns S75_OK or an Error code (see file s75.h)

Parameters:
Port  Pointer to a WORD that will receive a port number

int __stdcall getCAMWatchdogTimeout ( S75_Handle  S75Unit,
WORD *  timeout 
)

This function is used to read the CAM watchdog timeout on a CA device.

Returns S75_OK or an Error code (see file s75.h)

Parameters:
S75Unit  The S75_Handle of the device whose CAM watchdog timeout is being read
timeout  A pointer to variable where the timeout value (in seconds) will be stored

int __stdcall GetDeviceType ( S75_Handle  S75Unit,
WORD &  DevType 
)

This function returns the device type.

Returns S75_OK or an Error code (see file s75.h)

The device type can be one of the members of the enumeration NOVRA_DEVICES ...

  • S75_ANY (used internally during auto discovery)

  • S75_UNKNOWN (a device with firmware that is not recognized or sending bad status packets)

  • S75_V_1 (S75 Version 1 device, not supported by this library)

  • S75D_V21 (S75 Version 2.x device)

  • S75D_V3 (S75 Version 3 device)

  • A75 (ATSC Device)

  • PesMaker (S75 Version 5 PesMaker)

  • A75PesMaker (ATSC PesMaker)

  • S75_JLEO (S75 JSAT Leo-Palace device)

  • S75PLUS (S75 Plus device)

  • S75PLUSPRO (S75 Plus device with support for the PRO feature set)

  • S75CA (S75 Conditional Access device)

  • S75CAPRO (S75 Conditional Access device with support for the PRO feature set)

  • S75FK (S75 Fixed Key device)

  • S75FKPRO (S75 Fixed Key device with support for the PRO feature set)
Parameters:
S75Unit  The S75_Handle of the device whose type is being retrieved
DevType  A pointer to a WORD that will receive the device type

int __stdcall getFixedKeys ( S75_Handle  S75Unit,
BYTE *  KeyTable 
)

Gets the fixed keys from a device (S75FK & S75FK Pro).

Returns S75_OK or an Error code (see file s75.h)

S75FK_KeyList and S75FKPro_KeyList are equivalent stucture types

Fixed keys receivers do not send keys back to the host application. The stucture contents will tell you which PIDs have keys assigned and whether those keys are odd or even. These entries are to be used as placeholders for these keys when sending them back to the receiver using setFixedKeys(). If the placeholders are removed, then the keys will be removed from the receiver. If the placeholder key value is changed then the key on the receiver will be changed. If the placeholders are left alone, then the key on the receiver will be left alone also.

Parameters:
S75Unit  The S75_Handle of the device whose fixed keys are being obtained
KeyTable  A pointer to a structure to receive the fixed keys (should be of type S75FK_KeyList or S75FKPro_KeyList)

int __stdcall getPAT ( S75_Handle  S75Unit,
BYTE *  PAT 
)

Gets the PAT on a device (only Pro devices support this functionality).

Returns S75_OK or an Error code (see file s75.h)

S75PlusPro_PAT, S75CAPro_PAT and S75FKPro_PAT are equivalent stucture types

Parameters:
S75Unit  The S75_Handle of the device whose PAT is being obtained
PAT  A pointer to a structure to receive the PAT (one of S75PlusPro_PAT, S75CAPro_PAT or S75FKPro_PAT)

int __stdcall pollStatus ( S75_Handle  S75Unit,
BYTE *  status,
int  timeout 
)

This function will get the status of the S75Unit and fill the appropriate status structure. The status structure should be of the proper type for the device.

Returns S75_OK or an Error code (see file s75.h)

Unlike the getStatus function, which relies on the passive delivery of status packets, this function will send a message to an S75 asking it to send status back. This enables status to be acquired from a device that may not be on the same subnet as the host application.

Only the following devices support this functionality ...

  • S75 JLeo

  • S75+

  • S75+ Pro

  • S75CA

  • S75CA Pro

  • S75FK

  • S75FK Pro

The following structure types are all equiavlent to the S75Plus_Status structure

  • S75PlusPro_Status

  • S75CA_Status

  • S75CAPro_Status

  • S75FK_Status

  • S75FKPro_Status
Parameters:
S75Unit  The S75_Handle of the device whose status is being sought
status  A pointer to a buffer to receive the status (one of S75_Status_JLEO, S75Plus_Status, S75PlusPro_Status, S75CA_Status, S75CAPro_Status, S75FK_Status, S75FKPro_Status)
timeout  A timeout value (in milliseconds)

This function causes a reset of the CAM on an S75CA or S75CA Pro device.

Returns S75_OK or an Error code (see file s75.h)

Parameters:
S75Unit  The S75_Handle of the device being reset

int __stdcall resetS75 ( S75_Handle  S75Unit  ) 

This function causes a reset of the device firmware.

Returns S75_OK or an Error code (see file s75.h)

Parameters:

S75_Handle __stdcall s_forceS75 ( const char *  S75MACAddress,
const char *  S75IPAddress,
const int *  statusPort,
const int *  timeout 
)

Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

This function is deprecated and should not be used. Use ForceDevice instead.

This function creates a handle for communicating with an S75 receiver by forcing the S75 with the specified MAC address to accept a new IP address and status port. This is different from the open functions because they do not change any of the device network settings, whereas the force functions destroy whatever network configuration previously existed.

Returns a valid S75_Handle or a NULL pointer

Parameters:
S75MACAddress  a string containing the MAC address of the device (in the form xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx)
S75IPAddress  a string containing the IP address of the device (in the form ddd.ddd.ddd.ddd)
statusPort  a pointer to an int containing the status port used by the device
timeout  a pointer to an int containing a timeout (in milliseconds)

S75_Handle __stdcall s_openS75 ( const char *  S75IPAddress,
const char *  S75MACAddress,
const int *  statusPort,
const int *  timeout 
)

Creates a handle for communicating with a device.

Returns a valid S75_Handle or a NULL pointer

This function is deprecated and should not be used. Use openDevice instead.

Parameters:
S75IPAddress  a string containing the IP address of the device (in the form ddd.ddd.ddd.ddd)
S75MACAddress  a string containing the MAC address of the device (in the form xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx)
statusPort  a pointer to an int containing the status port used by the device
timeout  a pointer to an int containing a timeout (in milliseconds)

Variable Documentation

const WORD auto_detect_status_ports[num_auto_detect_ports]

Initial value:

 {      

        0x1974,
        0x2075,
        0x2175,
        0x2275,
        0x2375,
        0x2475,
        0x3475,
        0x4475,
        0x4575,
        0x4675

}
Novra's device discovery strategy assumes receivers will be sending status on a predefined list of ports. This is the list of auto-detection ports... already compiled into the library.

const int MAX_DEVICES = 64

The maximum number of devices that can be stored in a Novra_DeviceList.

const int NULL_PID = 0x1FFF

The value of the NULL PID.

const int num_auto_detect_ports = 10

Novra's device discovery strategy assumes receivers will be sending status on a predefined list of ports.

const int NUMBER_OF_FIXED_KEYS = 64

Maximum number of fixed keys that an FK device can hold at once.

const int S75_FAILED = -1

S75_FAILED indicates library function failed.

const int S75_OK = 0

S75_OK is returned by most library functions on success.

const int SIZE_PID_LIST = 32

Standard PID list size (some receivers support only 16).

const int SIZE_PROGRAM_LIST = 16

Number of DVB-S programs supported by most receivers.
